title: "Pausing mining while behind chain head" even though mining wasn't specified

labels.name: P4
labels.description: Low (ex: Node doesn't start up when the configuration file has unexpected "end-of-line" character)

body:
Seeing this log is odd for two reasons:
1) I didn't explicitly enable mining
2) Goerli doesn't have mining

If this means mining would actually begin, we need to make sure that doesn't happen. Even in the case where it's just a bad log, we should at least remove the log because it's confusing.

In Besu (rightly or wrongly) - everything which creates a block is deemed "mining".

In clique, mining is enabled by default - as your node _may_ at any time be voted into the "signing circle" - and you are expected to be able start mining at that stage - thus, you cannot explicitly enable/disable mining in Clique or IBFT2.
Of interest was this categorised as a P2? Its probable/frequent - but I'd have thought its impact is either marginal or insignificant ...

I categorized it as P2 because there was a chance it wasn't just a log issue but an actual pattern of mining starting when it wasn't supposed to. That's a pretty big departure from what the user might want. It had a wide range P2 in the worst case and P4 in the best :P
